title: Essentials of 5G | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Gain essential knowledge on 5G, including its technologies, example use cases, and tests for deployment. Enable digital transformation for industry verticals.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Gain essential knowledge on 5G, including its technologies, example use cases, and tests for deployment. Enable digital transformation for industry verticals.
5G has been touted as one of the technologies which will enable many new applications beyond cellular applications to support the digital transformation of a variety of industry verticals.

With the allocation of 5G spectrum completed, Singapore embarks on commercial 5G rollout. This intermediate-level course will provide you with the essential knowledge on 5G from foundations, example use cases, various technologies behind, and related tests and measurements for 5G deployments.

The two-day course will first give you an overview of 5G in terms of its key drivers, comparison with existing mobile technologies, example use cases, standardisation activities, and global rollout. It introduces the technologies that enable 5G such as massive MIMO, network densification, and network slicing. In addition, you will learn the various radio technologies, such as active antenna systems, beam-forming, and the challenges and solutions in emerging mmWave technology. Lastly, RF tests and measurements that go into making 5G deployments a reality will be covered.
Technical staff and product engineers who wish to upskill their knowledge in emerging 5G technology
Technology managers and decision makers who are interested in use-cases and in adopting 5G for business transformation
Anyone fascinated and keen to understand the principles and technologies behind 5G
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Prior to joining SIT, he worked in NTU and University of Malaya. He was a visiting Erskine fellow in the University of Caterbur, New Zealand and has also held visiting positions in the University of Bedfordshire and Bournemoth University, both in the UK. He works in the broad area of Digital Signal Processing and Wireless Communications. Specifically, his work involves the use of adaptive algorithms in modelling wireless channels and optimizing the physical layer characteristics. He interests also span applications of compressive sensing and underwater signal processing. He is Senior Member of IEEE . He has published several papers in International Journals and conferences.
Associate Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Venkat specialises in Applied Electromagnetics and RF Engineering. He teaches Radio Frequency related course under the SITLEARN programme. He has over 15 years of academic and industrial research experience in the different areas around applied electromagnetics. Prior to joining SIT, he was with ST Electronics, working on solutions for Satellite Communications and Sensors. He was with EADS (currently Airbus) involved in various projects such as effects of antenna siting, interference suppression in Instrument Landing Systems, Reconfigurable antennas to name a few. He has previously, served as an Adjunct Assistant Professor at National University of Singapore (NUS) where he used to teach a graduate-level course on Electromagnetic Compatibility. He is a senior member of the IEEE. He holds one patent granted by Singapore IPOS and has over 40 international journal and peer-reviewed conference publications. He has served as the reviewer for many international journals and chaired sessions in conferences related to applied electromagnetics. He has co-authored a chapter titled “Application of Multi-objective Optimization Algorithms in Electromagnetic Design Problems", in an edited book entitled “Real-World Multiobjective System Engineering”, published by Nova Science Publishers, NY, USA, Dec 2005. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering from the Anna University, India, a Master of Electrical Engineering from the Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio, USA and a Doctor of Philosophy from NUS, Singapore.

Pang Shang Hao is an experienced technical engineer in radio-monitoring, radio location, Over-the-Air (OTA) measurements and 5G domains at Rohde & Schwarz Asia. Shang Hao has extensive knowledge in providing technical consultation and trainings to customers. He has led successful deployment of numerous counter-UAV solutions for regional government agencies. Shang Hao graduated with B.E degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$1,962.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
